title: The Case of the Borrowed Mustache (and the Unexpected Ferret)
summary: The Mayor's legendary mustache is missing. In its place: a baffled ferret wearing tiny sunglasses. Solve four math clues to figure out whose alibi doesn't add up.

introLetter.subjectLine: URGENT: My mustache has been replaced with a ferret. Again.
bodyParagraphs: This morning, I woke up to discover my magnificent mustache has vanished. In its place is a ferret. A polite ferret. A ferret wearing tiny sunglasses that say 'DO NOT QUESTION ME.'
Three suspects were nearby. Each offered an alibi that sounded... mathematically confident.
Please investigate before the ferret holds a press conference.
introLetter.signature:
With trembling upper lip,
Mayor Mustachio Q. Whiskerboom

suspects.name: Lady Gigglesnort
suspects.roleTagline: Professional Unicyclist & Part-Time Dramatic Sigh Collector

alibi.claim: I pedaled from the park at 10, then rode +10 blocks, +5 blocks, and oops -2 blocks (banana peel). I ended at 23 blocks. Totally normal.
alibi.note: She says her route math lands on 23. Verify the steps.

quips: I only lie to my plants.
Banana peels are my true enemy.
If you hear honking, it wasn't me. Probably.

suspects.name: Professor Pumpernickel
suspects.roleTagline: Bread Scientist (PhD in Crumbs) & Alarmingly Confident Counter

alibi.claim: In my lab, I had 43 experimental loaves. Then 19 fell into the toast volcano. That leaves 26 loaves! Science!

quips: Numbers fear me. And yeast obeys me.
If I’m wrong, it’s the math’s fault.

suspects.name: Captain Honk
suspects.roleTagline: Goose in a Tiny Hat & Amateur Mailbag Juggler

alibi.claim: I carried two mailbags. One felt heavy, one felt light. I moved ONE parcel and then—HONK—both were exactly 25!
alibi.note: He says a single move balances both bags to 25.

quips: HONK means 'hello' and also 'I ate your sandwich.'
My hat is legally a captain now.
I do not know what a ferret is. Is it bread?

locations.name: City Hall (Mustache Emergency Wing)
locations.description: A fancy hallway filled with portraits. All the portraits have mustaches. Even the goldfish.

locations.name: Goofington Post Office
locations.description: The air smells like paper, glue, and decisions. A stamp machine hums ominously.

locations.name: The Bread Lab (Do Not Feed The Toast Volcano)
locations.description: Bubbling beakers. Flying crumbs. A sign that reads: 'IF IT RISES, WE'RE SURPRISED.'

evidence.label: Wormy Postage Receipt
evidence.description: A postage slip stamped: 'TOTAL VERIFIED.' It smells faintly of glitter and regret.

evidence.label: Balanced Bag Photo
evidence.description: A blurry photo of two mailbags perfectly balanced. A goose wing is photobombing.

evidence.label: Pigeon Math Bubble
evidence.description: A witness bubble: '43 pigeons, 19 left.' Someone wrote 'NOT 26!!!' in marker.

evidence.label: Unicycle Tire Tracks
evidence.description: A chalk outline of a wobbly path. The banana peel has been arrested.

puzzles.title: Stamp Licker 9000: Postage Panic
puzzles.prompt: Build EXACT postage for the Mayor’s emergency letter: 37¢. Drag stamps onto the envelope. Watch out: the glitter stamp demands its coupon worm friend.

ui.introLine: The stamp machine squeaks: 'FEED ME NUMBERS (and maybe snacks).'
successQuips: STAMPED! That envelope is officially too powerful.
Perfect postage! The mailbox salutes you.
You have pleased the Stamp Spirits.
failQuips: Close! The stamp machine sneezed confetti in disappointment.
The coupon worm wiggles: 'I yearn for accuracy.'

hints: Try making 37 with tens first, then add ones.
You can use a negative coupon stamp if it helps.
If you use a stamp that requires a friend, add its friend too.

puzzles.title: Suspicious Sack Scales
puzzles.prompt: Balance the two mailbags so BOTH weigh exactly 25. Drag movable parcels between bags. (Sealed parcels refuse to move because they’re shy.)

ui.introLine: Captain Honk whispers: 'HONK (this means: please do math).'
successQuips: Balanced! The scale does a happy little jig.
Perfect! The mailbags are emotionally equal now.
HONK of approval! (That’s a good honk.)
failQuips: Not balanced yet—the scale is doing the sad wiggle.
Close! One bag is still bragging.
The parcels rattle: 'We yearn for symmetry!'

hints: Add each bag to see how far from 25 it is.
If one bag is 5 too heavy, move a 5 to the other side.

puzzles.title: Pop the Odd Alibi Bubble
puzzles.prompt: Pop the bubble that equals 24 AND uses the numbers 43 and 19. (Someone’s loaf-counting seems… crispy.)

ui.introLine: A witness whispers: 'The pigeons know… the pigeons ALWAYS know.'
successQuips: POP! Truth sprays everywhere (it’s fine, it’s washable).
Correct! The bubble confesses with a tiny squeak.
You popped the lie! Somewhere, a calculator applauds.
failQuips: POP! That bubble was innocent. Awkward.
Not that one—try the bubble with the right numbers.
The pigeons shake their heads in synchronized judgment.

hints: You need the numbers 43 and 19 in the same bubble.
Look for subtraction, not just any 24.

bubbles.statement: I counted 43 pigeons, then 19 left wearing tiny hats.
I baked 18 buns and 6 tried to escape. Total buns: ???
HONK. I had 30 crackers, then 6 mysteriously disappeared into my beak.
I wobbled 20 times and then 4 more times. That is… a number!
I found 25 socks and lost 1 sock to the Sock Dimension.

puzzles.title: Tape-Measure Chase: Unicycle Route
puzzles.prompt: Start at 10 and reach 23 using EXACTLY 3 move cards. Choose wisely—banana peels are not a valid excuse in math court.

ui.introLine: You unroll the tape measure. It unrolls back. You glare. It behaves.
successQuips: Nailed it! The tape measure nods respectfully.
You reached 23! The banana peel files a complaint.
Route verified! Wobble science is real.
failQuips: Nope—your route drifted into the Swamp of Wrong Numbers.
So close! Try a different set of moves.
The tape measure retracts dramatically: 'I CANNOT WATCH THIS.'

hints: Try a big jump, then adjust with smaller moves.

finalQuestion.question: Which suspect’s alibi does NOT add up?
correctRationale: The pigeon witness bubble proves 43 - 19 = 24, not 26.
Lady Gigglesnort’s route math can reach 23 exactly using the move cards.
Captain Honk’s claim matches the balanced mailbag evidence (both end at 25 after one move).

lines: Her route can be verified to land on 23 using exactly three moves.
Also she is clearly too busy battling banana peels to steal mustaches (probably).
The mailbag puzzle shows a single parcel move can balance to 25 and 25.
He did honk suspiciously, but that’s… just how geese communicate.

correct.headline: CASE CLOSED: The Professor’s Math Was Toast.
bodyParagraphs: Professor Pumpernickel freezes like a baguette in a snowstorm.
"FINE!" he blurts. "I borrowed the mustache for… scientific reasons."
The ferret removes its tiny sunglasses. Underneath? EVEN TINIER SUNGLASSES.
The Mayor’s mustache is returned, slightly buttered, and emotionally stronger than ever.

incorrect.headline: NOT QUITE: The Ferret Shakes Its Head.
bodyParagraphs: The ferret squints behind its tiny sunglasses.
A gentle honk echoes somewhere. A bread crumb falls dramatically in slow motion.
Try again—one suspect’s numbers are the real culprit.

badges.name: Junior Inspector
badges.description: Solved your first case without getting honked into oblivion.
